alert.note: Alert for Baker; Colquitt; Dougherty; Mitchell; Tift (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dougherty, southern Turner, northeastern Mitchell, southern Lee, northeastern Baker, northern Colquitt, Tift and Worth Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newton to near Sylvester to near Omega. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Tifton, Albany, Ashburn, Sylvester, Putney, Leesburg, Camilla, Omega, Norman Park, Baconton, Poulan, Doerun, Ty Ty, Phillipsburg, Unionville, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City and Walker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
